sBieqmf_OdjnvjwSKSoHHw.text: This is one of the bars that makes the Carson Street experience enjoyable.  Although less so than The Library, Smokin' Joe's is one of those places that has multiple personalities depending on the time of day.  On weekdays and up until around 10pm on weekends, the place has regulars, you can use the pool table or play darts without too much trouble, and it's a great place to catch a Pens game.  Late night on weekends, the downstairs gets packed with one too many girls sipping on Washington Apple shots for my taste...But it's certainly still fun.  Unfortunately, unless there's a game on, the upstairs is always, well, boring, and the excellent beer selection does not extend to up there.  I wish they could do something to make better use of the upstairs space.  Don't expect the bartenders to know how to make any sort of specialty cocktail unless there's beer involved.  I'm obsessed with the Haystack: half Hoegaarden, half Framboise.  One thing that's a little backwards about Smokin' Joe's is the abundance of Miller Lite specials.  You are a beer bar with a huge selection on tap and hundreds of bottled beers:  Why all the specials on crappy beer?

5MtGGKZpq2faaWKN543BNA.text: I love Smokin' Joes!!! Definitely my favorite place in Southside. Sooo many beers to choose from & knowledgeable staff. Be sure to check out their new food menu too (new in July)...the lobster queso dip is amazing. I rented the upstairs for a party back in September and they were so accommodating & the party platter prices were great! You will definitely see me there as a regular :)

j_y3HEtHOHIVdvPJPujSYw.text: Great beer selection, fun atmosphere, the game on TV, and a casual feel.  Great place to unwind at the end of a long day, or a great place to begin at the start of an awesome night on the South Side.  Nothing jumps out as spectacular, but I'd still bring my friends.

bpQCTzGxzCei-8EtRg6vsg.text: Five Stars for Great Beer Selection!!! Doesn't look like much from the outside, but if you love beer, this will be your new home.  Not only do they likely have Every Single Beer You Know, they have about a million other kinds too.  If you like beer, and if you like adventure, you will love this place. The people are cool, but I found that it was far more fun to go with a huge group of friends and take over the place. And then meet people.

aSToe_Bn7nJ0noVSw1zkMA.text: I like the whole "upstairs/downstairs" thing the 'burgh bars have going on.  Downstairs was nuts - nearly impossible to move. Upstairs was much better. Decent beer selection. Fun times were had by all.

bC628uol3VgWqtpv9hfEsQ.text: My friend Justin swears by the food here. I never bought into it. The beer selection is one of the best in Pittsburgh though. Good crowd too. Not too many usual D-Bags like most of the Southside bars.

BLL6LPLq3f5SuhxV8pBxwQ.text: Went on a Saturday. They were having $2.50 vodka drinks. The fried provolone was delicious! We had 2 types of wings: the french something that was not that great, but the medium parmesan was great! Wings were served with celery and carrot sticks. We loved that we had 15 wings, cheese sticks, 4 vodka drinks & 4 draft beer for $36. The bartender was attentive and willing to make sure we liked the beers before ordering. She asked questions and gave several samples before we could decide on the perfect one. We sat at the bar and enjoyed every minute!

tWaFU6qDHlY0-JnZGB2imw.text: It's like home, but with a better beer selection.  Thanks Smokin' Joe's.

0fkGB2cOnvYu_HCUydW4CA.text: Here on Vacation last week.  Great place.  I watched football on Sunday.  Most locals were upset with the Steelers beat down that Baltimore handed them but no worries, at the end of the day the locals on the South Side still had a great time.  Good times with good people no doubt.

jjDXXgXHENxt4f9rTw4srg.text: This bar does what it sets out to do.  They have an excellent beer selection and have some pretty on the ball bartenders.  Like any bar in South Side, when it's crowded, the experience can be pretty miserable.  It's a high end beer joint infiltrated by douches who don't care what they're drinking.  I wish those guys would just drive down to Jack's and drink some swill.  If the downstairs is crowded, it might be worth it to go upstairs.  Bartender is equally as friendly and it's a smaller space, which can be good or bad.  I do repeat, why do people go to this bar just to drink a Bud.  It's like going to the Four Seasons and ordering a fucking hot dog.

-Gwi3950brW7YvZgDMjX_Q.text: Smokin' Joes, like many bars on Carson Street, differs depending on when you decide to go.  It's either loud, crowded and has top  40 music pumping, is packed with Penguins/Steelers fans during a game, or is relatively low key with patrons hanging out over sports and casual conversation.  I've decided to go during these different times and one thing is always a constant: the beer.  With an extreme bottle selection and an impressive draft selection, Smokin' Joes is the place to go on Carson Street for the beer lover (besides Carson Street Deli).  If it isn't too busy you are able to 'try before you buy' with their draft selection which is always nice when you want to try something new.  Due to the awkward setup of this bar, it gets quite jammed up on weekend nights when you first walk in but you can usually find some standing room in the back near the pool table and darts.  As for the food, typical pub grub fleshes out the menu.  The food won't blow your mind but will leave you content when hungry.  I've had the ribs with a side of fries and it was satisfying.  All in all, I enjoy Smokin' Joes during the more mellow parts of the day (before 9 pm on the weekends) but I find myself coming back quite often due to my affinity for delicious beer.

cPLOHpJ9XAEOcTNpwTMDHg.text: Great beer selection and fun name that tune and trivia events

nr28DifKBNMJQ4mznNKmgA.text: The finest speak easy in the tri state area and possibly the entire planet.  The Beer selection is as broad as your ever gonna get both on tap and in bottles.  Very fun atmosphere and the bartenders and wait staff are both very fun and friendly.  OK occasionally they will hijack the juke box and play music no mortal would want to hear but that's a minor flaw at most and playing a little Neil Young or Dylan on the box quickly erases the memory.  The food is good bar food not exceptional but still very tasty.  But I'm there for the beer, friends and fun.  Smokin' Joes is definitely a bar to frequent, god knows I certainly do!

zsnXSfcXPEgj7BkR80TwCA.text: Best beer selection in Pittsburgh. Bartenders are quick to make sure your glass is full. The food has gotten better over the years. It's not a five star restaurant, but the wings are tasty. Especially on Thursdays when it's 40 wings and a pitcher of miller light for $20. That's a deal you just can't beat, I wish the beer was a better choice, but it goes well with the wings. Pool table is cheap, only $0.50 per game. They play the Pittsburgh sports games on the tv and turn it on the overhead speakers, so if you're looking for a good place to drink some beer and watch some sports, Joe's is your place.

efpuGkySWMhEMuIGTOLxzw.text: Great layout and excellent use of space - Drinks and employees very friendly with a social but professional setting - Food on the other hand is just NORMAL - There is nothing that stands out! I tried their wings and they were average at best with nothing unique - No signature flavor, No homemade dressing, Fat Heads down the street has unique flavor that shows someone took the time to separate the menu and taste buds from everyone else. The establishment is a BAR so food shouldn't be the staple but on the Southside which every other building is a bar you have to standout.

c0I3dj7x4botPADPysy7hg.text: I have been to Smokin' Joe's on a few occasions and have mixed feelings.   The wings are some of my favorite around (probably why I keep coming back), they have a variety of flavors, quality wings with plenty of meat on them, and they are very reasonably priced.  In addition to the wings their Taco Tuesday special is a wonderful value with quality taco's compared to what you get at other restaurants during this special.   While the food is the bright spot of Smokin' Joe's the service and atmosphere certainly is not.  In the four times I have been there, I have never seen more than one server on the floor and one person staffing the bar and it shows in the service the customer receives.  It can be very difficult to get a drink refill once you have already received your food unless you are seated at the bar. In addition the servers are not very friendly, I attribute this to being understaffed, they always seem rushed and stressed. The bar at the front of the restaurant makes sitting at the bar a poor option.   Overall, I would return to Smokin' Joe's for the wings or with friends on Taco Tuesday but it would not be my first choice.   (Side note: if you spend $50+ dollars your receive a $5 gift certificate for your next visit...which is nice)

5Cz2KaMYz4y_WCM6dfphRQ.text: I've been here a couple of times; once for 30 cent wing night on a Monday, and once just to grab a few beers late on a Wednesday. The food is decent, we tried a few more items than just the wings. Portions are huge and reasonably priced, and you get options like salads as well as typical bar food. They have several TV's around the bar which usually show different games. What I like the best is their huge bottle selection! I'm originally from Europe, and I truly find myself missing some of the go-to beers I used to have back there. I have been looking for some of them at so many bars here in Pittsburgh, but only found them at Smokin' Joe's. Their beer prices are also really reasonable. However, it's obvious when the staff want to go home, or rather watch one of the games, or do anything but serve you. Their draft list is also quite outdated and they don't have everything that's on it. A bar I'll stop by more, but I honestly don't see myself becoming a regular.

aqORuYmJAEzGtQ8nEMpwKA.text: (non)smoking Joe's.  Great beer selection, good menu, friendly staff, great specials.  You really cannot go wrong here

R-_FiFBEvcsQHYj30MHNNQ.text: Drunk friends got you down? Leave TIki and come here for a  Calm shot of Patron.

1MrdR2A1lehvsST5bj6BZQ.text: AMAZING beer selection!!!  Wednesday nights is trivia nights, so much fun!  Crowd varies from college kids to older locals, depending on time of day.  Very hometown atmosphere.  Staff is very friendly. I always come here when i can't decide on a place to go.

byHuKvq1mlblYT0j5JZUkQ.text: Bartenders are great and are always willing to pour samples and suggest similar beers based on others you like. Great beer selection. The Mac & Cheese is fantastic!

E15uOhLQotSiiqa7mweUmA.text: I like coming here the food is pretty good nice selection of beers the atmosphere is friendly

4ChP-U4Tt_36jfRtJ-50-w.text: Smokin' Joes is one of those places...where they have tons of different beers on tap, where the food is yummy, where the jukebox selection always includes what you want (Mr. Roboto? You bet!)...and where everybody knows your name. This is the kind of place where the older South Side locals go 3-4 nights a week and have been for years. Pop in on any random night and most likely they'll be sitting at the bar. (Ask for Finn and tell him Kim sent you!)  It's also a home to young professionals and the college crowd, and overall the vibe is very chill and casual.   The staff are super friendly and always willing to suggest a brew if you're overwhelmed about the hundreds, yes hundreds, of drafts available. They have many hard-to-find selections and will give you a taste if you ask, definitely a beer-lovers dream.  Great wing selection as well and you can't beat the 35 cent wing specials during the week. Try the seasoned salt, the perfect complement to a nice cold beer. The pizza may take a little while to make but it's worth the wait. There's also a $2.50 vodka anything special on Saturdays. And if it gets a little too crowded for your liking on the weekend, just head upstairs to a secret bar where there's plenty of seating.  Definitely a must go if you've never been there and are looking for a great neighborhood bar!

ePROPc6OVJbyPKqYscHHUA.text: One of the best Draft beer selections in the city. Staff is awesome, friendly and quick to get you drinks. Food is good to great. Recommend wings and rib wrap. Good mix of people (older crowd which to me is better)

s_s2p_6I1T7ewttFbZIoCw.text: No smoking on East Carson is always awesome, and the draft selection is crazy good.  Totally average and some above average bar fare, but the 25 cent wings on wednesdays during Trivia was why we checked it out.  The wings and beer were good, but the Trivia kind of sucked.  It was crazy hard and the teams that were doing well had their phones out the whole time.  Also the host was basically making out with the microphone when reading the questions and was almost unintelligible.  And the song breaks and time to answer the questions were soooo longgg the whole thing dragged.  It was not  the trivia night for our group, but we will back back for the beers and wings.

1vsEH_jZJjOwVssV9_igHw.text: For beer lovers and  Casual drinkers alike  Don't pass this one up

JGYUMkImHxHe3I9Kkt6VEw.text: We stopped in on a whim one night to watch a Pens game and I have to say, I fell in love.  Fantastic drink specials Friday and Saturday night.  The bartenders are always nice and you rarely have to wait for anything.  Food wise I have only ever had the fried pickles, wings and the rib wrap.  It's bar food so don't expect anything healthy but that wrap is something special.

ToE0mKBbm7JpfyrMTT80_A.text: Tommy, otherwise known as Mikey, is the best bartender in all of greater Pittsburgh. Great beer selection. Great people.

92RW315e9w-3ZhJE951riw.text: Bartenders are inconsiderate jerks. I walked in well before happy hour, while 4 bartenders blatently ignored me. Then when I finally caught the attention of one female bartender, she refused to give me the special, even though it still wasn't 7. They were very inconsiderate, gave poor service, and I will never go back here.

vbo_tHKiDj23eJ6TEtprfg.text: I'm new to Yelp, but this is one place I will review.  East Carson Street is over-flowing with bars and restaurants. However, there is one place many seem to miss, and it's quite the hidden gem. If you like great beer, great bar food, friendly/cute/knowledgable cocktail waitress, and bartenders who know their drinks, Smoking Joe's is the place for you.  Commonly mistaken for a dive-bar, "The Joe" is a staple of the South Side for beer-lovers. I've been going there since I was underage, but this is one of the few places I will go back to. Has a very neighborhood/town-bar feel to it. The beer selection is incredible; they always have 65 beers on tap from all-around the world, including seasonal selections abound for those with adventurous taste-buds, in addition to over 300 or more on bottle.  The food is above-average and inexpensive. Their wings are the best in the Southside, and maybe the city. Tuesday and Wednesday nights are designated "Wing Nights", 30 cents each from 7 to 12, and Thursday night is "Yuengs and Wings Night", 40 wings and a pitcher of Yuengling for 12.95. Aside from the wings, the Burgers are good, and one of the better Steak Salads I've had. Everything is under 12 bucks.  The service is exceptional. Tommy and Llama run the bar, and they know their stuff. Just don't ask Tommy how he feels about Big Ben or the Steelers. The cocktail waitresses are cute, funny, attentive, and know their beers.   In terms of entertainment, there are plenty of HD-TV's around always playing whatever sporting events are taking place, and they will always allow you to change the channel to watch a different game if need be. They don't run a tight ship here, fairly laid-back. There is a Golden Tee machine, as well as a dart board, and a touch-screen Jukebox.  The crowd: Literally an eclectic mix of young professionals, thirty-somethings, folks from the neighborhood, and can become "College-y" on weekends. A self-proclaimed "Penguins" bar, this place always seems to fill up on game-nights. Like others said, weekends are hectic, but here's a secret; they have an upstairs called "The Distillery".  The Distillery is just a name for the upstairs bar. A smaller room littered with beer-paraphenilla, the upstairs has a smaller tap selection and a smaller bottled selection, but if not busy, the bartenders will go downstairs and get the beer of your choice. The bonus of the upstairs is the drop-down projection screen, great for hockey games or football games. This upstairs is only open Thursday, Friday, and Saturday evenings.  There are specials every night of the week, but you don't need an excuse to come by the Joe, get some wings, and have a beer you've never tried before. Just tell the boys what kinda beer you like, and they will point you in the right direction. Tell them John sent you in.

TCanWv0LnacitrJPdn5EOQ.text: Stuffed from a burger and sundae, I eventually ended up a few blocks down the street at Smokin' Joes to close out the afternoon. Of course I didn't eat anything, but just grabbed a drink. I was initially excited about the excellent variety of beer selections and I may have stayed for more than one pint except for one thing: the three douche bags sitting next to me at the bar.  Obviously, all single, late 30-something know-it-alls who felt it necessary to talk about international politics, recessive genetics and other completely random stuff, all ultra boring for a bar on a Saturday afternoon. It wouldn't have been nearly as bad had they not been the type of idiots who unintentionally talked loudly to one another, even though they were all sitting close together and there were few other patrons in the place. Apparently, we all had to hear the 'intellectuals' impart their wisdom on and about the world.   After a short time, I downed my beer, got an acknowledged eye-roll out of the guy sitting on my other side and got the heck out of there feeling very annoyed. I realize Joe's has no control over which idiots walk through their door, so I'll probably give them another chance someday.

eqMU8dGG-KawaW8kjTU3pQ.text: For Bar Food, Beer and Atmosphere - It is as good as it gets in PGH.

hj-lG7yfUeFKn7dCKXl1sg.text: Unhappy with a recent visit. We were told to 'wrap it up' with our drinks at 1:30am when they were just purchased. Two minutes later we were told the same thing. Im sorry but I work in a restaurant. When we have guests that are still drinking or eating, we wait patiently for them to finish. We don't kick them out just because we want to go home. The servers were rude. The one was walking around with her hood up the entire time looking unprofessional. We go there a lot so we were very disappointed with this past visit. The owner has always been friendly as well as the bartender that night who helped suggest drinks for us.  I would consider getting a new serving staff because I know I wouldn't want them in my restaurant being rude to customers like they were that night.

Xzzz1scuyHEId4AH-ZonPA.text: o.k. place to stop in for a quick one.....large selection of beers but not the best and friendly service..... the barmaid .just came up to me and with out even saying hello asked me if i wanted to know whats on tap and just handed  me a sheet of paper with the beer selection and walked away.....hummmm....the barmaid was maybe overwhelmed .....I had one and left....I was going to eat but again she wasn't very observant ..... I have been in the business for years and i would have been working that bar to the end of closing.....(if you want to make tips!!! ) but I would def. come back and give it a second try next time I come  into town in the next few weeks ......the bar looks cool inside and def. had a friendly crowed

YxkFxIo2FLZSMWPLZgdl8w.text: tons of beers on tap.  the rib wrap is a must of try if you have not.    Their wing special is also pretty good.    Nice laid back atmosphere and a good place to catch the game

XXy9YSjSnuVb9T4oemD2Yw.text: Goddamn, their beer selection is impressive!  Been in Pgh for about 2 months now, and I haven't been to another place that comes close to Smokin Joe's selection.   To make things even better, the waitresses are really attentive, and if you are indecisive about what beer to get, they're fairly knowledgeable and will let you try several beers before you make a decision.  The food is about the usual for bar food, however they do have specials for each day of the week (25 cent boneless chicken wings on Mondays, 75 cent sliders on Thursdays, etc).   The Friday and Saturday crowd seems to be a mix of undergraduates and graduate students.  Overall, it's a fairly chill and fun atmosphere.  Smokin Joe's is probably the best place for beer in town.

3SZAADMtrAMJJWiDi_KBnA.text: Best food I've had in a bar! The Lobster dip!! everything on the menu is outstanding!!

SLOctlpdbIr8F2TCRiPkww.text: The food is excellent and they have great deals, but the service here, which was once notoriously bad, has gotten even worse on the service end. The servers don't know what beers are on top or what drinks are or not available. Hopefully you don't mind waiting 30 minutes for 6-12 wings with many empty tables.

g8toE5WFRY0Nq4lyZm1S0w.text: Smokin' Joe's has become a regular stop for me in the past two years, mostly because I'm there once a week for trivia.  I like going here for several reasons:  First, they have an extensive and relatively cheap beer list.  60 on tap and over 300 in bottles.   Second, They are open 11 am - 2 am every day of the week.  Since my "weekend" is Monday-Tuesday, I appreciate somewhere I can go to unwind on a Sunday night.   Third, they have some of the best wings in the city.  if you go on a Wednesday, they are 40 cents each (25 for boneless).   Lastly, it's the perfect South Side "Goldilocks" bar.  It's not expensive and pretentious, but it's not so shady that you think you will get knifed if you insist on ordering something classier than Miller Light.   A few weaknesses to note. The bartenders are amazing, but some of their servers are painfully slow.  Also, the food menu is really hit or miss.  The wings, spinach dip, and french onion soup are all fantastic.  Their burgers and sandwiches are somewhat lacking.    Overall, however, Smokin' Jones is one of my favorite bars in the South Side.

h1bZr6LqPxO84YcO79cZkQ.text: After bad service at Primanti Bros, we came here because nothing else was really open on a Tuesday night. This place was more welcoming, had good drink specials and the food was pretty good.

MxkxzDHX3YMBrutvkVXLmw.text: Massive beer selection.  Chill but attentive bar staff.  The hot wings were also good.  I had a great experience here and would be back if I ever came to PA again.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bar

iaFKTIHIWiSB8spG9m6vkg.text: Decent drinks, prices, and atmosphere, but I had the worst customer experience service of my life here.   I was DDing for some friends on a trip to South Side, and they were planning to close the bars. While at Smokin Joes, the two others that I was with ordered a pitcher at about 1:15, and we were asked to leave at 1:30. When they asked to finish their pitcher, the server said "you are finished" and took it away / poured the roughly $20 pitcher down the drain. When I asked for the server's name, I planned to call the next day and complain and made that clear, he refused, began yelling, and grabbed me while escorting me out. This is the worst service that I have ever had, and I would avoid this place like the plague if it is past 12:30 am.

SdLZMwRhzxv9DzqdgJ2sNQ.text: Great selection of beer.  Appetizer deals and less parking difficulty were worth coming in earlier than the crowd.    Our waitress was less helpful than desired.  They should really just keep a chalkboard of the drafts on tap and erase them when no longer available instead of having the staff come back to the table like 8 times to tell us they were out.  She also screwed up our bills.  Burger was good at the moment, but a few hours later I felt like ass.  And, no, it wasn't because I was drinking- I didn't even get to have more than one.  Which, by the way, was a skunky Bell's Oberon.  I'm always curious when going to places with an extensive draft list how long the keg has actually been tapped....  I'll probably give it another try sometime.

4YTHhxPs1MH6f5s5QG0RsA.text: I used to LOVE to eat at Smokin' Joe's.  They used to have really great food.  However, now their food is REALLY bad.... I don't know what happened!  I don't know if they got a new chef or new supplier.... but we go out of our way to avoid having dinner here, which is sad because we used to love it.

rldcEpt-9_-LYFdo8DBdhw.text: On a recent weekend trip to PGH, stopped in here for a beer before last call.  Beer selection is, of course, amazing: 60+ taps and 300+ beers = you can't go wrong. Did not have food, as it was right before last call. Barkeeps were nice enough, knowledgeably chatting us up about Boston sports (where I'm from).  Will definitely be back on a future trip to sample more of their extensive beer list.

1F-JcR1MZutBemVz8ZnRbA.text: Food's not bad, but not great. Very loud music. Service is lacking. And tonight they were out of the draft special and had no buns, so burgers were being served on white bread. Really.

xMlJQ3veOJ2X-DzfggOtzQ.text: I love beer. 3 stars for that. It is a bar after all.  As one of the first places I visited when I moved to Pittsburgh I remember coming out of the bathroom and seeing a family of four with two young kids in the bar and nearly passing out. What is the deal in PA with being able to bring your kid to the bar. Now I have a kid and we regularly make it out for a pint.

HPbA3M9w5FosySBU4j96Sw.text: Absolutely the best Friday happy hour in Pittsburgh.  Half off appetizers from 5-10, $1 off drafts from 5-7 and then $2.50 domestic bottles (though not all) from 7-10, and they have an incredible beer selection--something like 60 beers on tap another 100-something bottled.  There were 6 of us grad students who went out, 2 beers each and enough food to warrant calling it a meal, and somehow with tax and tip it was $60. For SIX people.  What up, Pittsburgh.    The food was pretty good for bar food--bruschetta was a bit odd (maybe it was the bacon) but the mac & cheese bites, prov sticks, and hot peppers were great, and fries, zucchini planks, and potato skins were all quite good too.  The bar area is pretty long but they have tables with servers as well, and various games (pool, darts) around for your entertainment.  At 5:30 it was not very crowded but around 8 tables started becoming more scarce.

5Vg2u0e3AzFNK6D5b5yBgg.text: Smokin' Joe's is such a hidden gem in the world of bar food! The mac and cheese is a huge portion of thick, rich cheesy goodness easily sharable between 2-3 people (for only $7!), the burgers are consistently cooked perfectly, and the wings are great and almost always discounted. Plus, there's a massive selection of beer! The food often takes a bit to come out, so I wouldn't go there if you were starving or in a hurry, but otherwise, Smokin' Joe's is a great choice for a satisfying meal.

UkcyIVZbV8TIYCoduYt_Vg.text: With the least amount of pretension allowed by craft beer bar law, this place ranks high on my list of great beer bar destinations.  With over 60 drafts, and 350 bottles their selection covers some impressive ground.  The back bar couldn't be any simpler. Its a full length row of glass door coolers, exactly what you would expect to see along the back wall at a 7-Eleven convenience store.  (a wild fantasy 7-Eleven, but a 7-Eleven nonetheless).  These coolers are propped up a bit higher and leave the people sitting at the bar a good view of the beers offered.    The service was great - from both of the bartenders working the bar.  It was a very busy afternoon when I was there, and they made it look easy.  Great mix of very friendly locals and tourists.  To say that I have had a few beers in my life would be a tiny bit of an understatement.  I love to try new beers, or at least beers I have never had.  At Smokin' Joe's I had Moylan's Nitro Special Bitter, Anchor Brewing's Humming Ale,  Ballast Point Brewing's Reef Rye Brown Ale, and Elysian Brewing Company's The Immortal IPA.  I was impressed with all 4 of them, and oddly enough, most impressed with the Humming Ale.  Awesome selection.  Looking for a bit of a snack to go along with the beers, I ordered the pierogies and added the kielbasa option.  I saw them served to someone else across the bar and had to get them.  Unfortunately they were hard to find on the menu.  For some reason they are way in the back, almost listed as an afterthough.  They shouldn't be.  They were prepared just as I had hoped.  Topped with a bunch of quick high heat pan fried in butter white onions, leaving some teeth to them, but also giving some of that sweet caramelized flavor.    There is a large flatscreen TV on the wall that separates the front and back of the room.  The screen changes showing you their list out the most recent tapped beers, the list of IPA's only, and a few others.  Great idea.  I'll be back.

7n8bYXS8hHOkelXYp6-y6A.text: I'm huge on customer service and this place seemed as if they didn't know u they didn't care. Great draft selection with a mix of locals n crafts, but not busy and took the bartenders a while to ask us what we would like and didn't once have any interaction with them.  Pool table and darts. Seems like if u knew the bartenders you'd enjoy yourself a lot more.

UhWDIjB-kKt8CNWd73WSnA.text: They have a great beer selection, the food is good regular bar food, and the staff is great. They have a pool table and darts making it a fun place to hang. I'd rather come during the week because it gets crazy busy on the weekend nights.

1qcwBlxJpIBe0JmHMG5ycg.text: A good place to go during the week for a good beer and some bar food.  Smokin' Joe's has an excellent draft list and for fair prices.  The staff are friendly and polite and the place is just a little "divy".   The food isn't really worth it though.  The wings are 40cents a piece twice a week, but the wings are soggy and the sauces are bland.  I'd stick with beer you will be impressed.

eow7G3Q_VmIdzSFkNKIH9g.text: Would give this place a 0 if I could. My friend got kicked out for trying to buy a homeless man dinner. The waiter said the homeless coming in there is bad for business, instead that waiter has stopped me from ever giving this place my business again.

TU6CCgoLdbAbYWXWhDSFjQ.text: Good selection of beer and helpful bartender.  Unfortunately, they'd just tapped out 2 of the 3 beers we chose.

xvdeu8a9Hp6AM-1AMNCfHg.text: I always used to stop here for a quick drink, but never decided to order food. I did so about a month ago and couldn't believe what I was missing out on.  Since then, I've had the opportunity to try their excellent wings (with plenty of sauces/rubs to choose from), mouth watering flatbreads, great appetizers, and juicy burgers. The "southsider" flatbread is one of my favorites.  They also have 60+ beers on tap that will compliment any meal you order.   I've only had bad service once since I've been going here, but can say everyone is usually friendly and knowledgeable.  If you can't decide on a place to go, you can always rely on smokin joe.

jRlki5nHDow1wHHvM5K0yg.text: They have a lot of beers and change up the bottle selection regularly. The food is normal bar type thing. Fries are definitely some of the best.  That being said.... DO NOT sit at the tables, wait staff....umm not so good. By that I mean,  dont know the menu, and certainly dont know the beers, won't check on you, and will screw up your bill. (It wasn't very busy: no excuse) Overall recommendation: Sit at the bar, order a draft and get an order of fries.

AkbR9mfxHFHZepUxzeBP9w.text: 60 beer on draft,gluten free selections which made my night.also bottles.the servers are great and the wings are the best on Carson.

nzAY4TPArB10ghxgBFxPqQ.text: Honestly,  this place isn't that bad!   We went on a Friday evening after dinner for a drink. I was pleasantly surprised by how nice it was! They have a large selection of beer and I felt the staff helped us choose a beer we would like. I saw a few food items pass us, and they looked simple but fresh.    I was told that this place  can get busy, which I believe because they had a lot of staff working.  I mean initially the staff to guest ratio was 3:1. By the time we left the bar was full. Not packed but busy.  I look forward to going back here!

iLza01OdGnq9oj3YI59IMA.text: The South Side is packed with bars that might cause someone like myself with social anxiety to have a bit of a panic attack. Smokin Joe's though, is not one of those bars. If the packed crowds of South Side aren't your fancy, Joe's has solid food with a great beer and liquor selection. The service is fast, and excellent. A pool table, dart boards, and dozens of TVs as well make it a great hangout spot for anyone looking to start, or end their night away from the crowds in the South Side.

txzRzkdtuna_BhXYccTAPg.text: This place has been a favorite of mine for about 20 years. Friendly people, about a gazillion different types of beers and good burgers. Fun place to be and a great place to meet up with friends for a beer or five before heading out to a show or a concert.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Souther Tier Helles
Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MIhP4LvvRaDQss9retG4FA.text: I'm lucky that I get to travel for a living and I use my Yelp App to seek out great beer spots.  In the last year I have over 150 hotel nights in fourteen states.  So I've had a chance to visit a tremendous number of great beer joints!  My Holy Grail is the big three- A great beer selection, amazing gastro-pub food, and a bartender that looks like a Victoria's Secret model!  I haven't found this mystical place yet but I'll keep trying.  Smokin' Joe's is one for three but it's the most important one and that's a great beer selection.  What can I say; the tap list and the bottle list are both exceptional. The organization of the beer list itself is very good.  Many less traveled folks would probably say five stars but I'm going for 4.  The lists at the 5 star places include IBUs and a more extensive description of each beer.  BTW, the beer prices are very competitive here.    As others have said, the food is hit and miss here.  For me it was a miss.  Actually I'm not even going to discuss it. I'm going to think of these folks as a four star beer place without a menu.  If you are a beer aficionado and in the Pittsburgh area, a visit here is a must.  Just eat first and come here for the brews.

TA3e00GOqfLo4W4kGQeuXg.text: I know a lot of people who are regulars here, so I decided to visit for the first time today. My friends and I ended up leaving without getting food after an hour and a half of trying to get the waitress's attention. I asked the waitress if I could put an order in for food, she said she would be right back, then she never returned. It was crowded when we got there so we expected to wait for service, but by the time we left there were only a few tables occupied. It is clear that we were intentionally denied service as the waitress avoided eye contact at all costs. The food menu looked great and reasonably priced but I'll never go back.

dr3HHwU6-cTX9_SbT8JvOw.text: Definitely, an older crowd at this bar; I'd say the median age was around 40 on the night I went. Though, the crowd was agreeable (that is, no one was overly friendly or unwarrantedly rude). They have pool and darts in the back of the bar for those looking to play some games while drinking. There are also televisions everywhere, so there is no shortage of activities.  Moreover, Smokin' Joe's has an impressive beer selection. I was unable to count (or even find) all of the taps demonstrating how large the selection is. Additionally, there was a huge refrigerator with bottled beers behind the bar redoubling the beer count. Simply, impressive.

ha_ffRZu0rbXraMjgqjbdg.text: Apparently if you are a college student and don't tip 25% or more you don't get served.  Waitress and bar staff EXTREMELY RUDE.  They literally ignored repeat patrons because apparently a $2 tip on an $8 bill isn't enuf for lousy service.

ufhpYxDSknjxqnb8DBamLA.text: Pros: Great beer selection, good food  Cons: Terrible waitress experience, bait and switch drink specials   I have been here about 10 times over the last couple of years. I never had a problem before, until last night. They usually have some sort of special every day on their large beer selection, which is awesome.  I checked barsmart and they were supposed to have $2.00 domestic drafts from 7pm -12 on Friday. I know that website is not always up to date so I checked the bar's website which said that they would have $2.50 domestic bottles--no problem, still a deal.  When we arrived their was a chalkboard sign advertising $2.75 Labatt drafts for the Pens game and on the menu and on another chalkboard sign advertising 1.00 off Sam Adams pints from 7-12.  The waitress informed us that not only did they not have the Labatts because they were out, that they had no other specials. I asked about the website specials and she replied, "I don't know who does our website." I asked about the Sam Adams special and she said "that was only until 7"  We tried to show her the 6 ft chalkboard sign that was 3 ft away and the menu and her response was "I guess I can give it to you since you said you saw it"---as if we made it up! She was extra surly and barely accommodating.   There were 3 of us and we ordered food, so our bill was over $60.  I don't mind paying full price, I just didn't like the bait and switch and the attitude.

HHDqSjx_9yQwNjTzKGDacQ.text: Lots of beers. Good food. Nice staff. Tend to walk by you at the bar when you need a refill.  And the bathroom stall door needs repaired.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bathroom stall door doesn&#39;t lock

m2y8RZazNpwPHA8YM020GA.text: The Good.  Awesome beer selection. On tap and in bottles.  A great bartender. Sweet, attentive and not afraid to tell you if a beer sucks.  A mean Bloody Mary. Thick and spicy.  The rib wrap. Seriously, it's just ribs in a wrap. Can't be bad. The wings are fat and juicy, and the spicy BBQ is a winner. Smokin' Joe's is a perfect place to catch a game. Good food, good beer, and good people.  The Bad.  They don't toss the wings in the sauce...just dump it on top. Same goes for the "rubs." The burger was huge, but overcooked and dry. Good flavors on the Reuburger though.  The Ugly.   There's Jack, and other liquor available in the soda gun. That could definitely get ugly.

9BD9MTuCXJ_omKP1nW9P0A.text: We came in to try a hard to find beer that Smokin Joe's happened to have on tap. We thought we would have some thirty cent boneless wings. Well we ordered the beer but instead of wings we ordered Blackened Chicken Nachos and Mac n Cheese (which they are known for. The beer-Founders Canadian Breakfast Stout-was well worth the trip and the $13 a glass price.  The nachos were huge and the blackened chicken have them a nice flavor. I wasn't a fan of their salsa, but I would order them again. The server suggested some bacon on too of the Mac n Cheese. It was a huge plate of cheesy goodness. I barely ate a third of it. The bacon was a great addition but a couple of the pieces were really hard. I chewed each bit carefully but there were only two really hard pieces that were tiny. The rest of the bacon was fine.  They have four more beers on tap that I would like to come back to try as well as their Lobster Queso (which they are also known for).  This is definitely a bar with high top tables and bar stools, but the service is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nachos with Blackened Chicken
Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mac n Cheese with Bacon

tXxZyaXamLU7KaS6deJmXw.text: I was only here for beers at the bar during a Pens game, although the food coming out of the kitchen smelled like greasy bar food in the best way - perfect fries are like catnip to me.  The special all afternoon Saturday was Yuengling for $2.50, although they do have a great selection of craft beers on tap and Belgian/craft beer in bottles.  Our server was attentive and the right blend of "I have to wear this tank top because I'm a girl bartender" and laid-back.  While the bar was full for the game, there were only 2 tables filled.  I'm torn between reserving this for when I want a beer fix and trying food.  What I experienced was a-okay though.

zGnL3KdrlAKQz3azcH-8kQ.text: I've lived on southside 2 years now and just walked into Smokin' Joe's for the first time. As soon as I walked in I began salivating at the beer selection. 6 massive bottle coolers behind the bar and 60 different draft selections. CRAFT BEER HEAVEN. The bartender Kara greeted me right away and was very friendly and knowledgeable about the food menu and beer selection. This may just become my new local hangout. I officially love this place. There are pictures covering every inch of the walls, the bar is wooden, and there's a pool table. Seems like a perfect bar for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The &#34;New York Burger&#34; which Kara set in front of me and said, &#34;Congratulations, you&#39;ve just ordered are like best burger&#34;

NdUvL_d47D8egCYJfYfcCA.text: This place is one of my favorite bars on the South Side... and this is coming from an Eagles/Flyers fan. The service is excellent and I never had trouble getting a drink.  The wings are phenomenal and I highly recommend ordering them even if you're not terribly hungry.  They run really good specials and they have pool and darts.  Smokin Joes is basically a fun place to hang out for the night with a large group of friends.

l1PA8J7XbaxFU3MztXDscA.text: My favorite bar in South Side.  Excellent selection of beer and knowledgable staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Arrogant Bastard Ale is my favorite!

Kwn4uWLlDiKVFkXz5VGHCA.text: I came here with a big group of about 20ish poeple for happy hour. We gave them a heads up beforehand but when we got there they looked severely understaffed (with only one bartender and one server). The girl took our orders pretty quickly and was very nice so it wasnt an issue.   The food took a while to come out (granted we did order A LOT so this was expected). They were generally pretty good about keeping track of who ordered what but did not manange to bring out my friends food in time with everyone elses. He had to ask two times where his order was while everyone else was eating and it finally came out around an hour later. While I understand the stress of serving a big group, I feel like the restaurant should have been better equipped with handling big crowds.   The food itself was hit or miss. The wings, provolone sticks, and tacos are very tasty. The burgersm on the other hand, are a bit dry and tasteless. They also have a very extensive selection of brews that I have to come back to try.   Overall, I would come here for the happy hour tacos and wings but wouldnt recommend for a venue for big crowds.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 1.75$ tacos on happy hour
Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. cheese sticks were amazing

G5qOyQMG9gZy6wMESfUFVg.text: I always have a great time a Smokin Joe's. They have great specials on drinks and food on most days. I went on a Thursday, and it just so happened to be half off burger night. I got the BBQ Bacon Burger Which was cooked to perfection.  The wings are also a great item on the menu. There are a bunch of flavors, and they go well with the wide assortment of beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

h17RW7SBADcXcmL9djtpqw.text: This is my favorite place in Pittsburgh besides PNC Park. Excellent beer selection, both tap and bottle. Really cool people working the bar, even if they do get really slammed, because the place gets busy whether there's a sporting event going on in town or not. The food is hefty and delicious. I had the pizza fries. The people next to me had the nacho fries and wings, and I wish I had gone that route instead, but only because they looked amazing. I would try everything I could to make a trip here every time I come to the Burgh.  Note: I forgot to pay when I was there last weekend. I realized it the next morning and came in to settle up. It was no biggie, but I'm appreciative of my friends behind the bar for their patience.

b4L9EmgCuq2gOSzBfV2htQ.text: Is there anyone out there that has done the bar crawl on e. carson? ..because ive lived in southside since 2014 and there are still bars I haven't gone to. In my defense, I had been to smoking joes in the summer.. not sure how I skipped reviewing it.  I always passed by thinking it was just another dive bar with bar food. Its def not your basic spot. The food menu is cool and unique. Some things that caught my eye were kielbasa and bacon skewers, powdered pretzel bites (deep fried soft pretzels with powdered sugar), brisket & beer cheese nachos ect. They also have favorites such as a Rachel, Reuben, flatbreads, cheesesteaks and a great mix of burgers.  Our go-to here is the lobster queso dip which is served with tortilla chips. It is delicious and it isn't lacking on the lobster. It tastes fresh (fresher than you'd think it'd be at a bar). You can also order the lobster queso on fries. I have also had their perogies (delish) and a burger with fries.  (bbq bacon burger)  Their draft list is huge. There is a bar, seating area and pool table. Its a cool bar with great food. Service is friendly as well. I believe kitchen is open late. We came in after 11pm on a Thursday and they were still serving.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Draft List! Tons of options (fall selections are seasonal of course)
Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Queso Dip. Amazing!!

LoFe3GKQFH2UMXx9oP4w-w.text: Did a wing tour while visiting Pittsburgh and our winner (by a lot) was Smokin' Joe's. Great vibe and tasty ass wings. The guy who served us recommended hot garlic and they were our favorite.  Send my regards to the chef.

q8lqHuz9758sXmPusV8kAA.text: With an amazing beer selection and bar games (pool & darts) this is a gem that I need to think about frequenting more often. They kitchen menu is decent, and while I haven't eaten there in years, I do recall enjoying the wings.  They have specials each day and the waitstaff was incredible when we were there on New Years Eve (day).  Certainly a place to check out in the southside!

photos.caption: Photo of Smokin' Joe's - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Daily specials.

bTuPoQEYtcsl3lfH_8NZnQ.text: I really like this place and it has a great beer selection but service is way too slow.

8tXbHSq7HOf5z2T6ngpD9Q.text: As a cider drinker, I love it when I find a bar with cider on tap. Lots of beer choices and 2 ciders on tap. Also lots of choices in bottles. Bartender was friendly and helpful. Mid day was quiet and comfy.

VWYquFC1TF3bisfzdi8_CA.text: Really great beer bar!  There is a good selection of tap beers as well as a large cooler area behind the bar with a ton of different beers.  We stopped in here after dinner, so while they have food and it looked pretty good, we just had drinks.  We were there on trivia night and the rear table area of the bar was packed, but we easily found a couple of seats at the bar.  The bartenders were nice and attentive.  I grabbed one of the beers from the tap list to start.  It was ok, but while drinking that one I was able to really give the cooler a look and found something I wanted.  The price was also very good.  A few beers each and we didn't pay all that much.  Definitely a place I'd love to return to next time I'm in town.

E0gVVfCxcE87XmCsMAMTTA.text: Walking in, the front bar area is very tight and narrow. Lots of people congregating around the bar, which makes pasage to the back room tables or the upstairs a challenge at times. The bar is quite long with ample seating.  Never had a problem with outdated bottles or beer that did not taste quite right on tap.  The bartenders and waitresses, they are really nice and quite knowledgable about beer, the problem is, there are not enough of them, especially when it is late at night or during a Pens/Steelers game. So the service is good, just not enough of it...  There are a ton of bottled beers (200+) and beers on tap (at least 40) here. There is no shortage of varying style of beer. They do quite well keeping up with the seasonals as well.  Average bar food...nothing going to blow you out of the water here.   A great bar for beer quality and quantity. A must stop when on the Southside, beware of the crowds at night and during sporting events.

YmnSvDJLvqCZTvdbaB3rFA.text: This is my go-to spot for quick bites on Carson. I live close by and the wait-staff is friendly, professional and accommodating to special requests.  The food is excellent and plentiful!

pGi35DZVaHe_Lx7cUm7zNg.text: Perfectly fine place if you are looking for a wide range of drafts.   Somehow it didn't stick to my mind though. There are a lot of great bars along this bar street.

Ty9r23ljeXm52LZsLHVbow.text: Stopped by Smokin' Joe's a couple times for a drink and a bite to eat. It gets pretty crowded, at least it was when I was there for a Penguins game and for trivia/30 cent wings. They have a good selection of drinks and a good kitchen menu. I've tried the mac n cheese and boneless mild parm, Cajun, and sweet Italian wings. All were very tasty and seemed freshly made. The service is friendly and attentive and it's a great spot for a bite and a drink. I'll definitely be back.

6DWmRbmCMFyE5TnANBYWcw.text: This is my favorite local bar to hang out, grab a brew, and hang with friends. The bartenders are friendly, funny and always at your service. The mac and cheese is a great pick from the menu if you are in the market for some munch. Another lesser known but interesting and useful thing to know about Smokin' Joe's is the room upstairs available to rent for functions. There's a bar and plenty of seating, a great find for a birthday party or other special occasion. The beer selection on tap is great, but they have an even bigger cooler with cans and bottles with a wide variety of choices.  Check this place out, it's a winner!

hFd9GDKbYJ4rg4w4G5xUZA.text: Smokin' Joe's is so quintessentially PGH that its almost adorable.  Almost.  If you're a craft beer fan without an ounce of pretentiousness, this unassuming joint is an absolute beer oasis. I'm talking HUNDREDS of beers. On. Tap.  Yessssss.  When we lived on the "sathsihde", we made it a habit to saunter up and down E. Carson Street to people watch, bar hop, or grab a bite. To this day, E. Carson is the best street I've ever lived on and I miss it immensely. We frequented Smokin' Joe's than I'd like to admit.  The food at Smoking' Joe's was pretty straight forward - sandwiches, wings, fries, so unless they've changed their menu around,  I wasn't ever truly wow'd. But, that's not what makes SJ's such a lovable spot. Its the beer, beer selection and the staff.  There's also games in the back of the house, but admittedly, the only time I wandered back there was to visit the grungy ladies room. I spent the majority of the time trying to scout a seat at the bar, watching the Pens on the multitude of TVs.

6QGTjD2cbNnnkO6s9_UZ4A.text: Smokin' Joe's is possibly my favorite bar in the South Side.  If only it wasn't the favorite of so many others, too, I'd probably stop over more frequently than I do.  It's a great neighborhood bar with an impressive beer selection (both on tap and in bottles).  With over 50 taps, they do offer beer flights and growlers.  Most times when I think I'll just stop in for a beer I will also end up ordering food because it just smells so good.  Be sure to check daily food and drink specials.  I used to work in the South Side and would often hit up Smokin' Joe's for their lunch specials.  It's mostly your average bar food but I was never disappointed.  It's a chill place for a quick bite or a long night of drinking.  If you're looking for velvet ropes, don't go here.  Smokin' Joe's has been around for awhile, it's not one of those pretentious places that will be gone in two months.    When I lived in the South Side, the charismatic bartenders at Smokin' Joe's kept me coming back.  The vast beer selection and tasty food didn't hurt, either.  In fact, I think I'm about due to stop back in.

Cxh73ByX6HpYx3Y7a_NTnw.text: Huge selection of beer! Good food and Great service! Bartenders are awesome!!! A must visit for anyone in the south side!

eTVW_3lnjZ1_JStzc_Gwwg.text: As a former Southside resident, Smoking Joe's has been a regular establishment for most occasions, in any and all weather and for any type of crowd. Despite my first check-in here, this is obviously not my first visit to the place, so this review will be a mashup of many trips. The last check in was this past Saturday a Pittsburgh Happy Hour Valentine's Day Barcrawl.  I found my group towards the back of the bar by the pool table and within was greeted and attended to within 5 minutes of arrival. Joe's has a large list of rotating draft and craft beers so I naturally asked for the current specials and the stout selection. [It's currently chocolate stout season - which is my favorite] I was delighted to find that Joe's served Southern Tier's Chokolat [10% ABV American Imperial/Double Stout]. On average, Joe's has around 100 different types of Beer in house so you are sure to find just what you are hankering for.   Being hungry, the waitress fetched me a menu, again, well between within the appropriate 5 minute window. The selection is standard American Pub food, ranging from Wings, loaded fries to sandwiches and wraps. Each day of the week during the 5-7pm happy hour there is a different food special so be sure to check back different days of the week. My personal favorite, however, are the Ribs. Joe's will always have my heart on the Ribs as they were the only location who was willing to serve me at 1am on a Saturday during Snowmageddon February 2010. The full slab is served with a full basket of fries and a large side of coleslaw.  If you not one to ogle over the Beer selection or gossip with the Barkeep, you can easily entertain yourself with the ever popular Pool table or Darts. The lighting is dimmed for the typical South Side atmosphere and the prices are average for the city and on the lower end for Carson street. The waitstaff is efficient and friendly and the entirety of the experience is satisfyingly homestyle.   Bravo and keep it up.

Soqbd0Uy5Fh2z2UVH672cw.text: From a mainly strictly drinking perspective- this place is awesome. TONS of craft beers on tap and they have tons of bottles as well - to drink there or to take home.   The staff is really awesome and friendly and has been happy to help me decide what beer to try each time I have gone. There are so many beers and can be a little overwhelming when you first walk in, so don't hesitate to ask their opinion!   I have yet to eat anything here besides the fried pickles. They are pickle chips and are honestly not my favorite, but they aren't bad. You get a lot of them and if you come during happy hour they're half off!   Smokin joes is overall an awesome place to kick back, watch a game or go to happy hour and drink some awesome beers! It gets packed on the weekends, so get there early on a Friday or Saturday!

Ayiu01XoM--I_LxnV7O9Lw.text: Arthichoke Dip.   That is all I have to say about Smokin' Joe's.   Kidding, but the Starter is my favorite item on the food menu. The Rib Wrap is pretty freakin' good as well! Smokin' Joe's has typical bar food, with many items that have a "Pittsburgh twist"!   It is a smaller bar, but is a great place to meet up with friends to catch the Steelers game or play a few rounds of pool with.
